Description: A terracotta head of an old woman, broken from a figure; her hair is parted in the middle and drawn back into a sakkos. Mould-made, with some hand-working. Buff marl ware (probably Egyptian), with a buff-grey surface. Traces of pink paint on the face.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased. Ptolemaic, third century BC. Bibliog: Stevens' 'Sale Catalogue', 14 December 1866: Gupper Bey's Sale: lot 37.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3527)
